segments.pli: Saṃyutta Nikāya 56
segments.en: Linked Discourses 56

segments.pli: 5. Papātavagga
segments.en: 5. A Cliff

segments.pli: 43. Mahāpariḷāhasutta
segments.en: 43. The Mighty Fever

segments.pli: “Atthi, bhikkhave, mahāpariḷāho nāma nirayo.
segments.en: “Mendicants, there is a hell called ‘The Mighty Fever’.

segments.pli: Tattha yaṃ kiñci cakkhunā rūpaṃ passati, aniṭṭharūpaññeva passati no iṭṭharūpaṃ; akantarūpaññeva passati no kantarūpaṃ; amanāparūpaññeva passati no manāparūpaṃ.
segments.en: There, whatever sight you see with your eye is unlikable, not likable; undesirable, not desirable; unpleasant, not pleasant.

segments.pli: Yaṃ kiñci sotena saddaṃ suṇāti … pe …
segments.en: Whatever sound you hear … Whatever odor you smell … Whatever flavor you taste …

segments.pli: yaṃ kiñci kāyena phoṭṭhabbaṃ phusati … pe …
segments.en: Whatever touch you feel …

segments.pli: yaṃ kiñci manasā dhammaṃ vijānāti, aniṭṭharūpaññeva vijānāti no iṭṭharūpaṃ; akantarūpaññeva vijānāti no kantarūpaṃ; amanāparūpaññeva vijānāti no manāparūpan”ti.
segments.en: Whatever thought you know with your mind is unlikable, not likable; undesirable, not desirable; unpleasant, not pleasant.”

segments.pli: Evaṃ vutte, aññataro bhikkhu bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: When he said this, one of the mendicants said to the Buddha,

segments.pli: “mahā vata so, bhante, pariḷāho, sumahā vata so, bhante, pariḷāho.
segments.en: “Sir, that fever really is mighty, so very mighty.

segments.pli: Atthi nu kho, bhante, etamhā pariḷāhā añño pariḷāho mahantataro ceva bhayānakataro cā”ti?
segments.en: Is there any other fever more mighty and terrifying than this one?”

segments.pli: “Atthi kho, bhikkhu, etamhā pariḷāhā añño pariḷāho mahantataro ca bhayānakataro cā”ti.
segments.en: “There is, mendicant.”

segments.pli: “Katamo pana, bhante, etamhā pariḷāhā añño pariḷāho mahantataro ca bhayānakataro cā”ti?
segments.en: “But sir, what is it?”

segments.pli: “Ye hi keci, bhikkhave, samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā ‘idaṃ dukkhan’ti yathābhūtaṃ nappajānanti … pe …
segments.en: “Mendicants, there are ascetics and brahmins who don’t truly understand about suffering, its origin, its cessation, and the path.

segments.pli: ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti yathābhūtaṃ nappajānanti, te jātisaṃvattanikesu saṅkhāresu abhiramanti … pe …
segments.en: They take pleasure in choices that lead to rebirth …

segments.pli: abhiratā … pe … abhisaṅkharonti … pe …
segments.en: They continue to make such choices …

segments.pli: abhisaṅkharitvā jātipariḷāhenapi pariḍayhanti, jarāpariḷāhenapi pariḍayhanti, maraṇapariḷāhenapi pariḍayhanti, sokaparidevadukkhadomanassupāyāsapariḷāhenapi pariḍayhanti.
segments.en: Having made such choices, they burn with the fever of rebirth, old age, and death, of sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress.

segments.pli: Te na parimuccanti jātiyā jarāya maraṇena sokehi paridevehi dukkhehi domanassehi upāyāsehi.
segments.en: They’re not freed from rebirth, old age, and death, from sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress.

segments.pli: ‘Na parimuccanti dukkhasmā’ti vadāmi.
segments.en: They’re not freed from suffering, I say.

segments.pli: Ye ca kho keci, bhikkhave, samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā ‘idaṃ dukkhan’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānanti … pe … ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānanti.
segments.en: There are ascetics and brahmins who truly understand about suffering, its origin, its cessation, and the path.

segments.pli: Te jātisaṃvattanikesu saṅkhāresu nābhiramanti … pe …
segments.en: They don’t take pleasure in choices that lead to rebirth …

segments.pli: anabhiratā … pe … nābhisaṅkharonti … pe …
segments.en: They stop making such choices …

segments.pli: anabhisaṅkharitvā jātipariḷāhenapi na pariḍayhanti, jarāpariḷāhenapi na pariḍayhanti, maraṇapariḷāhenapi na pariḍayhanti, sokaparidevadukkhadomanassupāyāsapariḷāhenapi na pariḍayhanti.
segments.en: Having stopped making such choices, they don’t burn with the fever of rebirth, old age, and death, of sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress.

segments.pli: Te parimuccanti jātiyā jarāya maraṇena sokehi paridevehi dukkhehi domanassehi upāyāsehi.
segments.en: They’re freed from rebirth, old age, and death, from sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress.

segments.pli: ‘Parimuccanti dukkhasmā’ti vadāmi.
segments.en: They’re freed from suffering, I say.

segments.pli: Tasmātiha, bhikkhave, ‘idaṃ dukkhan’ti yogo karaṇīyo … pe … ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti yogo karaṇīyo”ti.
segments.en: That’s why you should practice meditation …”

segments.pli: Tatiyaṃ.

sections.title: “Mendicants, there is a hell called ‘The Mighty Fever’.…

suttaplex.blurb: The Buddha speaks of a hell called the great inferno, and points out that those who do not understand the four noble truths fall into a still fiercer inferno.
